website_summaries.verdict: Get your child's eyes off the device and back into the real world with these Minecraft cards.
pros: A good game for Minecraft fans
Players can mine, craft and reserve just like the electric version of the game
It really does an effective job of getting your screen addicted kid to have some off-screen time
cons: If you are not familiar with Minecraft, this card game may be a little confusing to learn

customer_reviews.title: surprisingly fun! I don't know ANYTHING about Minecraft and let ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 11 year old son's birthday 4 months ago and just played it tonight... surprisingly fun! I don't know ANYTHING about Minecraft and let me assure you that he knows "everything". You do not need to understand the video game to play this card game. Was really fun (I had been dreading playing it for months) and now we are playing again tomorrow... got a 1-1 tie breaker to see who is champion!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth F.

customer_reviews.title: We watched a YouTube video to see how it was played- which worked out WAY better than reading the confusing instructions
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Minecraft-addicted 7 year old girl. She loves it. We watched a YouTube video to see how it was played- which worked out WAY better than reading the confusing instructions. Do a search and you'll find numerous videos doing a game demo. So helpful. A great way for her to enjoy Minecraft, without starving at a screen. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Aimee E. Flinn Nechanicky

customer_reviews.title: this is a good alternative! My son likes to play this with ...
customer_reviews.text: If you have a kid who loves Minecraft but you are trying to get them off the screen for a bit, this is a good alternative! My son likes to play this with others and on his own.
customer_reviews.author: T Scott

customer_reviews.title: Super fun and easy family game
customer_reviews.text: This game is so much fun! It took a bit to learn, but once you get the hang of it, it's is a blast. The cards are nice and thick, and it's easy to set up and put away. Not too much of a learning curve at all. We got this for our family for Christmas and played it several times every day for a couple weeks. One of our favorite family games! And you can play with as few as 2 people, which is nice. My son, who is on the autism spectrum (and he loves Minecraft) loves this game.
customer_reviews.author: meljen

customer_reviews.title: This game is awesome. I mean
customer_reviews.text: This game is awesome. I mean, it's not rocket science but our family of four is actually sitting down to play together. Took a few minutes and patience from the kids to learn, but now we play game after game. Can amend rules (adjust point totals) so that a game can go from 10-30 minutes. Kids like playing "Creative" mode so that we just play until board; fun enough for them just flip cards and defeat the Creeper with your shovel card!
customer_reviews.author: KRIS

customer_reviews.title: A very fun way to engage young Minecraft fans.
customer_reviews.text: This is a game the whole family enjoys, enough strategy to be interesting but rules simple enough for the kids to get the hang of. I am really happy I purchased this. It is a fun game on it's own merits not simply a marketing gimmick. If you are wanting to connect in the real world with a kid who only talks about Minecraft this game is a million times better than reading outloud the 20th Gameknight999 book I promise you!
customer_reviews.author: Erin F.

customer_reviews.title: It was a hit with my teenage sons!
customer_reviews.text: Because I am not familiar with minecraft, I had a hard time understanding the instructions. But my 14 year old son who is very familiar with minecraft understood most of the instructions easily at first. There was a few things he didn't understand until after playing once with his 16 year old brother. They love it and have already played it a few times in the last 24 hours and can't wait to play it with their friends.
customer_reviews.author: Chereen

customer_reviews.title: This game is a must for Minecraft and game enthusiasts ...
customer_reviews.text: This game is a must for Minecraft and game enthusiasts. It doesn't follow the same rules as the video game minecraft (as far as crafting recipes, which confused my son a bit at first). This is a cute game where you can play against each other to collect resource cards and craft weapons that increase your turns or defenses against creepers. The directions are a little vague, so you might have to improvise your own directions in some situations.
customer_reviews.author: Mom2three

customer_reviews.title: Family fun
customer_reviews.text: I’m not a fan of video games. My 8 year old loves Minecraft. This game was a perfect way to connect with him using something he was “familiar” with. I can continue limiting screen time and add family time and he feels like I’m sharing his love of Minecraft. The game is easy to learn. The cards are good quality. There’s some strategy involved but nothing too difficult for a child to learn.
customer_reviews.author: AP

customer_reviews.title: Fun game to keep you busy for a couple hours
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to my son for Christmas and it turned into a game we all enjoyed including my 6 year old. There isn't any reading involved so once she picked up the concept it was easy to play. You do not have to know or like Minecraft to play or enjoy the game. Everyone had a blast. A single game will take 10 to 15 min to play so games were short enough to give everyone a chance to win.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Breinig

customer_reviews.title: So fun!
customer_reviews.text: I'm embarrassed to admit this, but I often beg my son to play this with me. He likes it a lot, but probably not as much as I do, haha. It's such a fun game. He beats me almost every time. He is 11 years old. Once you learn the very simple rules, you won't forget them. It's so easy to play.
customer_reviews.author: amandamay24

customer_reviews.title: Fun game, 6yo enjoyed it
customer_reviews.text: Fun card game, a little bit of a learning curve, but my 6yo was super excited about receiving it for his birthday. We played it today, and it was entertaining enough to get competitive, but short enough for a mom with a headache to power through 😅 Id recommend it for a minecraft loving kid or adult
customer_reviews.author: DLMVLM

customer_reviews.title: I actually enjoyed it
customer_reviews.text: So the directions are not so hot But a quick YouTube video solves that easily. It’s actually reasonably fun. My 8yo and I play regularly. It involves critical thinking and strategy. Probably takes 20 minutes for a whole game. I have played MUCH more painful games than this!
customer_reviews.author: smposto

customer_reviews.title: New family go to game
customer_reviews.text: So much fun for kids and the adults. For those of us who just can't do the video thing with our kids this is the perfect middle ground. It is so much fun that this now our (the parents) go to game (beating out taco verses burrito...also tons of fun).
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Fun Minecraft Card Game
customer_reviews.text: My kids enjoy playing this card game a lot. They like how you can do many of the same things as you do in the actual game. It’s also a strategic game, so it appeals to many types of players. It’s great that there’s a card game that appeals to young gamers.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: An Introductory Tabletop Game
customer_reviews.text: Neat game. I'm not personally a fan of Minecraft, but my sister's foster son is. This is pretty simple to learn. It's basically a "recipe" game. You gather resources and then use them to "craft" items which give you points in the game. A good way to get Minecraft fans to set down their controller for a while.
customer_reviews.author: I.H.

customer_reviews.title: Fun game for Minecraft fans.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son because he loves everything Minecraft. This game is really fun and easy to play. I like that you can use different strategies to try and win. My son played with his friends and they really liked it, it was easy enough for them to play with no help. It will keep kids busy for around 20 to 30 minutes as it is not incredibly challenging but it is a fun game to come back to over and over.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: ... a gift for my Minecraft loving son and he loved it. The directions were easy to understand and ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my Minecraft loving son and he loved it. The directions were easy to understand and even though I don't know a lot about Minecraft, I had a lot of fun playing with him. He loves this game and has played it a lot with friends and with family. Fun game that incorporates Minecraft without being plugged in and on the screen. Would recommend for any Minecraft fan!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Minecraft fans will probably like it
customer_reviews.text: Our 10 year old son loves Minecraft. The game takes some focus but if you "get" all the crafting of Minecraft you will not have a problem with it. It can be a little overwhelming for younger children or adults that don't get the Minecraft concept.
customer_reviews.author: Deb B

customer_reviews.title: Fun for the whole family
customer_reviews.text: We bought this game for our son who loves Minecraft. Turns out the whole family enjoys this game. You don’t have to be a Minecraft fan or know anything about it to learn and enjoy playing this game.
customer_reviews.author: gscardwe

customer_reviews.title: My kids are 9 and 10 and love Minecraft. We've played a few games and they ...
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure what to expect with this game, but was pleasantly surprised. My kids are 9 and 10 and love Minecraft. We've played a few games and they both gave it a thumbs-up. If your kids are still in elementary school, I'd recommend having and adult explain and play through a couple of hands. It took a few plays to get the hang of the rules and I don't think younger kids would pick it up by themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Scott R.

customer_reviews.title: Great for ALL Minecraft fans of any age!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this gift for a 15 year old MineCraft fan for his birthday. I was afraid it would be too young for him, but he really enjoyed it. Seems like a good gift for any Minecraft fan of any age!! (I did not actually use the item, just heard the glowing reviews from him!)
customer_reviews.author: Casey JonesTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: The game is easy to learn and fun for those who want to ...
customer_reviews.text: The game is easy to learn and fun for those who want to get their young ones off of the Minecraft video game and more into traditional games while still keeping the young'un engaged. Like many card games, it isn't as fun with 2 people, but once you get to 3+ people playing, it becomes a lot more fun.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher N. DiNardo

customer_reviews.title: Good game for the family
customer_reviews.text: This game is really addicting to play and establish to set up. I’m totally into social games to play and this is one of them. Multiple Strageties can be made in the game for most ages, even the kiddos. I love to play it with my son.
customer_reviews.author: Jad Ibrahim Jr., MBA, MS, BCBA, LBA

customer_reviews.title: Great family game!
customer_reviews.text: This game is easy to learn, even if you don't know anything about minecraft. It's cute and rounds are relatively short. Highly recommend! Even Grammy plays!
customer_reviews.author: sunnypreposition

customer_reviews.title: Actually MUCH more fun than I thought it would be
customer_reviews.text: Actually MUCH more fun than I thought it would be. My 8 year old who loves minecraft but hates boardgames loves it. It is the perfect compromise to get him to play with us since you don't have to love Minecraft to enjoy it. It seems kind of confusing when you first read it, but once you set it up like instructed and start the game, it's easy to catch on. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Megan Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Fun game for minecraft lovers or others
customer_reviews.text: Fun game. Don't have to know minecraft. Both my 9 year old and (not really reading) Kindergartner could play. Good strategy game but not too hard. Even the parents could tolerate this! Probably more interesting if you like minecraft. Inexpensive and small so it is easy to bring with you in a purse or backpack.
customer_reviews.author: J. FORCUM

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, will buy again as a gift for other Minecraft fans
customer_reviews.text: My son is a Mincecraft addict. I got this to put in his Easter basket and he absolutely loves it. The whole family has played the game and I was impressed they found a way to incorporate the ideas of the electronic game into a card game. The box is nice and big, seems of great quality. I would definitely suggest this to any Minecraft lover and will purchase it again as a gift for his friends.
customer_reviews.author: M&M Mom

customer_reviews.title: Easy to learn and play. Great gift!
customer_reviews.text: Minecraft Card Game arrived on time in excellent condition. I purchased this item as a birthday gift for an 8 year old. Game was very easy to learn and a great gift choice. Lots of fun and a great way to spend time with friends/family.
customer_reviews.author: Davina

customer_reviews.title: Grandsons LOVED!
customer_reviews.text: What a surprise they got when opening. They love card games and loved Minecraft even more. So combine the two and they were in 7th Heaven!
customer_reviews.author: cynthia little

customer_reviews.title: but decided to play this card game with him and I had so much fun with him
customer_reviews.text: I bought this card game for my 10 year old son. I have never played Minecraft at all, but decided to play this card game with him and I had so much fun with him. Now I am interested in playing the real game... I understand now why. :) And of course, he absolutely loves this card game! I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: miris

customer_reviews.title: Fun for Minecraft lovers and anyone else too
customer_reviews.text: Fun easy game to play even if you don’t know anything about Minecraft. Great way to spend time with my Minecraft loving kid! My kids are 3 and 7. The 3yr old could play with a little help.
customer_reviews.author: Elise P. or Jody D.

customer_reviews.title: fast, simple, fun
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I gave this game to our 11 year old and we actually enjoy playing it with him. It's a fast and simple game. You build with resources. Strategy does help you to win... so my son and I usually have to team up against my husband to prevent him from winning.
customer_reviews.author: DevotedMomWifeNurse

customer_reviews.title: Too confusing.
customer_reviews.text: I was excited and had really high hopes for this game for my brother who loves Minecraft. but no one could figure it out. You would think it would be a simple enough game but it doesn't make any sense.
customer_reviews.author: Maddie

customer_reviews.title: 8 year old loves it
customer_reviews.text: An easy, quick game. My eight-year-old Minecraft fan enjoys it. Only takes about 15 minutes to play, so it’s a nice little break between other activities.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Okay.
customer_reviews.text: My son loves Minecraft but had no interest in this game. We played once and it was difficult for an 8-year-old. Maybe we didn’t understand the instructions?
customer_reviews.author: Smart Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Lots of family fun time with this game.
customer_reviews.text: Glad we bought this for my son. Since the quarantine we play way more cards and board games. This is a family favorite.
customer_reviews.author: MommaInspired

customer_reviews.title: Great game and really fun!
customer_reviews.text: Really fun game to play with the kids. Only issue with the game is the directions on how to play aren’t clear. Had to watch a video on YouTube on how to play it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Funk

customer_reviews.title: Fun for the whole family!
customer_reviews.text: My husband, 5yr old son, and I play this card game frequently. It's fast paced and it's a great counting/math tool for my kindergartener who needs to add in order to craft. He loves minecraft and this is a great alternative to having them in front of a screen and allows for interactive play! It's a big hit in our home.
customer_reviews.author: claudia83

customer_reviews.title: It's a really great game! Read the directions and at first didn't ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a really great game! Read the directions and at first didn't understand it, but once we started playing it all made sense. It's a really creative game and requires strategy. Definitely a winner!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen C.

customer_reviews.title: I'm sure it's fun. Well
customer_reviews.text: If the instruction were more clear you wouldn't have to look up how to play the game on youtube. Otherwise, I'm sure it's fun. Well, it is fun, because you have to make up rules as you go along because the instructions are not clear. Anyway, if you are a Minecrafter like my kid, you just buy Minecraft stuff, so who cares.
customer_reviews.author: Book Fan

customer_reviews.title: 8 year old loves it! So do parents :)
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old son loves this game. He caught on quickly. If you've played Minecraft for even just 20 minutes, you'll very quickly understand what all the symbols are. But an understanding of the video game isn't required to play the card game. Its a game my husband & I can play with the kids, or by ourselves. Our son loves it! And its a good strategy game to make him think.
customer_reviews.author: jmw

customer_reviews.title: Ok game, not very exciting though.
customer_reviews.text: Ok game. We've only played it once, but so far but there really isn't much to the game so not incredibly exciting other than the theme of minecraft. The artwork on the cards are great. The game play is a tad complex and instructions for some things aren't entirely clear so we improvised a little bit. I don't recommend for kids under 7 or 8. Child should definitely be able to read well to play it.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun Dewey

customer_reviews.title: This is a really fun game. My kids all play minecraft
customer_reviews.text: This is a really fun game. My kids all play minecraft, and they like this too. I enjoy playing this with them, and I only know the very basic concepts of minecraft. The game is fun with or without that background. Players ages: 6, 9, 38
customer_reviews.author: momandmore

customer_reviews.title: Fun game. Different from anything I have ever played
customer_reviews.text: Fun game. Different from anything I have ever played. The idea is to collect points by building tools. Good balance between luck and skill to win. My 11 year old brother enjoyed it. Even my 7 year old nephew was able to play although it's probably more suited for the 9+ age range.
customer_reviews.author: Riv

customer_reviews.title: not for very young kids
customer_reviews.text: as an adult I didn't care for this. my grandson ,who is 10 loves it
customer_reviews.author: sandy lindquist

customer_reviews.title: The kids all love Minecraft so it was a hit
customer_reviews.text: The first few rounds were confusing, but made a little more sense as we played. The kids all love Minecraft so it was a hit. The card holders are pretty pointless, they just bend the cards all up
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun for Kids and Adults
customer_reviews.text: My grandson, 8, and I play this for hours. It was surprisingly easy to learn and fun to play. My 6-year-old had trouble with rules so I'd stick with 8 as lowest age.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Fun fun fun
customer_reviews.text: This game is so much fun even if only 2 people are playing.
customer_reviews.author: Corie

customer_reviews.title: Get it for your minecraft enthusiasts!!!
customer_reviews.text: Simple, addicting game. Great for minecraft nerds. Seeing them get off their phones and playing a minecraft game in real life was an experience. Get it for your minecraft enthusiasts!!!! Game takes less than 30 minutes to finish playing.
customer_reviews.author: Wynn

customer_reviews.title: Go for it, they are great
customer_reviews.text: Great gift and great game! Would buy again and for a gift as well!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda W.

customer_reviews.title: Great gift!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for a friend's little boy. He loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: So good to see him playing something that is not electronic
customer_reviews.text: So good to see him playing something that is not electronic. He got all his siblings to take turns playing with him. Great graphics.Good hook for a minecraft fan to interact with more than just the xbox.
customer_reviews.author: A customer

customer_reviews.title: My boys are super into Minecraft
customer_reviews.text: My boys are super into Minecraft, so I thought this would be a great game for them to play when they aren't allowed to have their i-Pads. I was very confident in a positive reaction to this... They played it the first day... I haven't saw it since. I may need to remind them, or it's simply not that fun. Much bigger than expected...
customer_reviews.author: Erin J.

customer_reviews.title: Fun Game
customer_reviews.text: Fun game and we were able to learn it fairly quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Rob of Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Confusing for mom of 6 and 8yo boys who love minecraft. I lost my patience trying to figure ...
customer_reviews.text: Confusing for mom of 6 and 8yo boys who love minecraft. I lost my patience trying to figure it out. I'm sure they'll like it in a few years though...assuming they will still like minecraft by then.
customer_reviews.author: M. McErlean

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: gift to great granddaughter.... I think she likes it. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen B.

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for Christmas for my son and it's great! We love playing it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for Christmas for my son and it's great! We love playing it. It's a bit complicated at first, but you can quickly pick it up. Doesn't take more than 20-30 minutes to play.
customer_reviews.author: Toni

customer_reviews.title: Confusing directions!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 8 year old grandson who is an avid Minecrafter! I read the game directions several times and could not figure out how to play. Disappointed.....
customer_reviews.author: Chemmom

customer_reviews.title: Good for kids who like Minecraft.
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this game and plays it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: skwirly88

customer_reviews.title: Fun game!
customer_reviews.text: Cute game to get them in the game off the device.
customer_reviews.author: indygal

customer_reviews.title: Play with kids
customer_reviews.text: 9 yr old autistic grandson taught us to play! Is a very fun game.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Banks

customer_reviews.title: Learning Curve, but really super fun!
customer_reviews.text: Once my 8 year old son, husband and I played the first round, it was a bit easier to understand. However, I would suggest two adults play a round or two to get the hang of all of the rules, it will be much easier to teach a child that way! Super fun game!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Bogad

customer_reviews.title: Good card game for mine craft fans.
customer_reviews.text: It is a good game. It gets a bit boring tho. Needs a bit of polishing and improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Abignale

customer_reviews.title: Fun game
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 10 year old and he liked it. If you have played splendor, it has a similar feel, but easier. Fun game!
customer_reviews.author: NaeNae

customer_reviews.title: Instructions are incomplete
customer_reviews.text: This game may be fun, IF you can ever figure out how to play. The instructions don't cover the basics, like how many cards to deal to each player. We gave up.. disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: mom of 2 boys

customer_reviews.title: Really easy to understand, easy to play.
customer_reviews.text: Really easy to understand, easy to play. I play regularly now with a 9 yera old and a 7 year old. Easy enough to understand, and the 9 year old genuinely usually wins!
customer_reviews.author: Megan L.

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Good
customer_reviews.text: This game was a big hit with my son! We like playing Splendor and this is similar, but with a theme he enjoys more. I can't stand watching him play Minecraft... just can't handle the pixels and don't see the appeal (wow, do I sound old) but the card game is something I can definitely handle.
customer_reviews.author: bradysmom

customer_reviews.title: My family likes this one
customer_reviews.text: My wife and son really like this game. It's been interesting the couple times I've played, but I think some of the rules are a little absurd. But admittedly I don't play minecraft so maybe that's how things work in the video game.
customer_reviews.author: Ejohnson

customer_reviews.title: Get the Minecraft fan off of the TV..... with this Minecraft Card Game.
customer_reviews.text: Our son LOVES Minecraft as well as board or card games - this was a perfect Christmas Gift for him! We played it and was at first was a little confused, but we got the hang of it quickly and was a super fun game!
customer_reviews.author: Honu

customer_reviews.title: My kids love this game
customer_reviews.text: My kids love this game!! They are 5 and 9 and they play by themselves or with us. They are huge minecraft fans and this game is just interesting enough to keep them engaged but not too complicated. Its perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 3

customer_reviews.title: Its a fun game and isn't complicated to learn or to
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our son and the whole family loves it! Its a fun game and isn't complicated to learn or to play
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Had to watch a utube video to figure out how ...
customer_reviews.text: Had to watch a utube video to figure out how to play the game as the instructions that come with it are not real clear. After watching the video it was much easier to understand.
customer_reviews.author: W. Bugg

customer_reviews.title: Fun game.
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old minecraft fan loves this. It is fun for even non-minecrafters to play. My son says the crafting recipes are not the same in the game, but you can overlook this and just have fun playing together.
customer_reviews.author: Clan Master

customer_reviews.title: Fun Minecraft card game.
customer_reviews.text: This is such a fun and easy to learn game. I recommend this for anyone who loves Minecraft. It is nice to have a family game that is related to something that interests the kid enough that he will play it with us. Our son is 8 years old.
customer_reviews.author: Rayne

customer_reviews.title: Fun game!
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old loves Minecraft and he was over the moon when we purchased this game! He can play it over and over and still have fun. Recommend for all Minecrafters!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Ruley

customer_reviews.title: this game is quite good and my grandson loves it
customer_reviews.text: I did not expect much out of this game. My grandson is addicted to Minecraft. I just wanted to ease him away from the computer. Surprisingly, this game is quite good and my grandson loves it. Good job!!
customer_reviews.author: Charles P. Scott

customer_reviews.title: fun game
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my son, who is 9 for his week long sleep-away camp gift. He loves it. He played with this friends in the cabin. He said it was easy to learn and fun to play.
customer_reviews.author: Chien Ting

customer_reviews.title: No idea how to play this
customer_reviews.text: I could not for the life of me figure out how to play this game, so my six year old and I made up our own rules. I guess if you know a thing or two about miecraft you could figure it out. I am clueless and this game was beyond this lame parent.
customer_reviews.author: JennyO

customer_reviews.title: "Really fun!"  ( - said my two sons, aged 11 & 13)
customer_reviews.text: Finally, something my two boys can play together that they BOTH like, that does not involve a screen...!
customer_reviews.author: EarthyOne

customer_reviews.title: Hit with kids
customer_reviews.text: Grandson's into anything Minecraft and thus gave them a way to play off the computer.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Very Poor Instructions
customer_reviews.text: Incomplete directions so you really don't know how to play. We watched a youtube video to help us figure out this game which helped but still very hard to figure out. Too bad, it might be fun.
customer_reviews.author: bonnieb

customer_reviews.title: I was surprised at how much fun we all had playing it
customer_reviews.text: My son has been begging to get this game. I was surprised at how much fun we all had playing it.
customer_reviews.author: ADubb

customer_reviews.title: Fun but overly simple
customer_reviews.text: It was fun and we'll made but my kids played 3 or 4 games and were done with it . My kids are 8 and 9 and love Minecraft but this didn't stick .
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Daddy

customer_reviews.title: Instructions are a bit all over the place. Read thoroughly
customer_reviews.text: It's a bit hard to follow until you've read and reread the instructions and played a few rounds. Once you get going the kids find it a very competitive game.
customer_reviews.author: jrenken88

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun and simple enough for my 5 and 7 year ...
customer_reviews.text: Lots of fun and simple enough for my 5 and 7 year olds to understand. Great family game night game for some minecraft loving kids!
customer_reviews.author: dansmommy

customer_reviews.title: My 7 and 9 year old love to play this game
customer_reviews.text: My 7 and 9 year old love to play this game. Rules are simple and game short enough that they don’t lose interest before game ends.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Benson

customer_reviews.title: Minecraft Magic
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game even for the younger kids. Ours love to play this game all the time! I do not feel guilty in letting them play often as it helps to define their thinking with strategies and math. If your kids like Minecraft then I bet they too would love this game.
customer_reviews.author: Organic Mom of 5

customer_reviews.title: Fun game
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend son loves it. He loves minecraft and loved playing this game
customer_reviews.author: vanessa calzada

customer_reviews.title: Fun Minecraft card game.
customer_reviews.text: Great game, if your kids know Minecraft! ages 6+ could do this, a bit slower, than the recommended 8+.
customer_reviews.author: SOLSEN

customer_reviews.title: Very fun game, great way to spend family time together ...
customer_reviews.text: Very fun game, great way to spend family time together and without being in front of the screen. Would help if the littles one know the basics about Minecraft.
customer_reviews.author: P. Chow

customer_reviews.title: Crafting Fix When Screen Time Is Over
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old loves this. Even when we aren't playing the actual game he often gets the cards out and plays with them by himself in his own way. The box is a good size and travels easily.
customer_reviews.author: Laura R

customer_reviews.title: Kids love this game
customer_reviews.text: Got this card game for my 11 and 12 year old. They enjoy this game and play it often. The cards are durable and have kept in good shape so far. The instructions are easy to follow and easy to read.
customer_reviews.author: Ginger Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Great game for fans!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 5 year old for holidays, he's a new minecraft fan, this does say ages 8 and up, but with some help I think he can play, if you know the rules of minecraft then you can play this, fun for the whole family!
customer_reviews.author: BoyMom2

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: son loves playing this on computer; now loves playing the card game

customer_reviews.text: My family members are a big fan of minecraft. I bought this game for the little ones, and they love it. It took them awhile to learn how to play, but they enjoyed it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Ma

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: great family game! the kids love it. its easy to learn. the instructions are initially confusing ("we will get to that later") but after a trial run we figured it out.

customer_reviews.title: It's cool but takes some brains to figure out how to ...
customer_reviews.text: It's cool but takes some brains to figure out how to play. Seems like it is a very short game too. But we enjoyed playing.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Bryan

customer_reviews.title: It's a fun game that takes from 1/2 hour to 1 hour ...
customer_reviews.text: The instructions were a little hard to understand, but after watching some you tube videos, my family got this down. It's a fun game that takes from 1/2 hour to 1 hour to play.
customer_reviews.author: Riekeant

product_meta.title: Mattel Games Minecraft Card Game
product_meta.description:
The fun keeps building with the Minecraft Card Game! Based on the hit video game, players have the opportunity to mine, craft or reserve to win. Players “mine” Resource Cards of Wood, Stone, Iron, Diamond, or Gold, and then use those cards to “craft” Craft Cards for points. If you desire a certain Craft Card, but are currently unable to pay for it, you may Reserve the card in your card holder to craft later. Craft Cards can become Tools with special powers you can you can use in your favor to control the game play—but watch out! TNT and Creeper cards are hiding in the deck for unexpected upsets. The player who reaches the game point goal first, wins! Colors and decorations may vary.

BRAND STORY
By Minecraft
feature_bullets: Keep building the fun with the Minecraft Card Game.
Mine, Craft or Reserve to win.
Includes Resource, Craft, TNT, Creeper and Wild cards.
Reach the game point goal first and win!

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
